title: Is the match making system fair In high diamond +

embed.description: Check your Summoner Stats / MMR, Live Spectate and using powerful global LoL Statistics!

body:
is it fair for the match making system fair. would players rather wait for longer ques ? or be matched with plat 2 players etc if you check the link there are example's of it. as a higher (elo) player i have ran into this problem way to much where i have came across a bunch of plats in my games and they all have 500 + games in high plat they have a long way to go i done the hard yards and climbed to high diamond just to get them again. and as you can see i have positive win loss ratios decent (mmr) theirs no reason why i should be matched with any one lower then diamond 4 and if your lucky 2 diamond 5s per game sounds fair. and this is basically for any one in diamond above + having the same issues i want to no others peoples view on the topic im sure alot of people have had the same issue.

replies.body:
Hey dude, 

I went through your last 10 matches in OP.GG and looked up the rankings of each player

http://i.imgur.com/1dFnBVQ.png

Every column is 1 game and Blue is your allies, green is you and red is the enemies.

There are two things I want to discuss here;

1) In your last 10 games you've only got multiple plat players on your team once.

2) In terms of matchmaking, I believe the match making system does its best job to find a fair game. Unfortunately when you get to the higher MMR's the number of players around your level is very low (because few make it to your level of play!). So sometimes to find a fair game the match making system will need to expand the range at which it looks for players. This means once in awhile you will get some plat players in your games. 

Sure this could be fixed if we gave you hour + queue times. But do you really want to increase queue times by an immense amount just so you don't get plat teams once in awhile?

Your point about the point loss issue is spot on and riot know this, tbh I really don't think they care, I am not diamond nor will I ever be, but it doesn't take a genius to work out what riot do and don't care about, it is the same old story, use a bandaid to fix the problem, they have been doing this for 5 years that I have been playing. simple solutions

#1  prompt user before asking them to join a match letting them know they have not been ideally matched asking them would they like to proceed.

#2 using their mobile app to link high elo or any players letting them know at that particular time "hey there quite a few players closely matched with you on the server now come and join"

it isn't so much do you want to wait longer, its mostly about peoples routines, and gaming routines when they are on, MOST people are usually on at the same times occasionally at random but more often at distinct times of the day and certain days you will find the same players in your matches. come on riot this really isn't rocket science please get your sht together your destroying a once decent game!

Dynamic queue + oce just doesn't work. Around 2k summoners are d5+. Take that into account and assume how many play around the same time as you do. Having a small player base results in ridiculously long queue times and absurd mmr gaps in games :L
